Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a light-brown pottery vessel, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic inscription giving date year 10 and identifying contents as western river wine.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 54
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393141) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393141)
